Nathan Duggins
Resume Portfolio Contact

Summary

GIS technician and Part 107 pilot with over 1,000 hours of UAV flight time. Business owner with experience in client generation and retention, employee relations, and business operations. Currently working in the GIS field interpreting and digitizing satellite imagery.

Skills and Abilities

  • Photogrammetry software such as Agisoft Metashape, Pix4D, and OpenDronemap
  • Experience with point cloud data in CloudCompare and Meshlab
  • GIS software like ArcGIS and QGIS
  • Video editing with Adobe Premiere Pro and Adobe After Effects
  • Photo/Design software like Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Lightroom
  • Microsoft Office suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook

Certifications

  • GIS Part 107 UAV Pilot

Education

Front Range Community College, Boulder, Colorado

  • Associate of Applied Science in Geospatial Science (GIS), 2023
  • 4.0 GPA
  • Expected Bachelor's Degree in 2025

Projects

National Park Service - Point Reyes National Park

  • Mapped several Northern California beaches with a multispectral sensor mounted on a UAV and collected ground control points.
  • Processed data into deliverables including orthophotos, calibrated reflectance layers, and DEMs.
  • Aided in classification of local flora and fauna in the intertidal region.

University of Northern Colorado/City of Longmont

  • Mapped a stretch of the Saint Vrain Creek to assess reconstruction efforts since the 2013 flood and set a baseline for future projects.
